com.example.diningapp

Class MenuRequester

  • java.lang.Object
      • com.example.diningapp.MenuRequester

  • public class MenuRequester
extends
    Scrapes the cornell webserver using a POST request to get menu data
    Author:
    James Stoyell

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.net.URL baseURL
      The baseURL for the POST request, formed in the constructor
      private java.lang.String date
      The current date, formatted such that it can be used for the Cornell Dining's POST request
      private Hall eats
      The Hall to retrieve information about
      private java.lang.String meal
      The meal to be requested - Breakfast, Lunch, Brunch, or Dinner
      private TextView menu
      The menu TextView that this information should be added to
      private static java.util.regex.Pattern MENU_PATTERN
      The menu regex pattern that matches an item on the menu
      java.lang.String returnMenuString
      The String to be returned - defaults to error message so that if it remains unchanged the user is displayed a message
      private java.lang.String USER_AGENT
      The User Agent used for this class's POST request

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MenuRequester(java.lang.String date, java.lang.String meal, Hall eats, TextView menu)
      Precondition: All parameters are formatted as needed for a POST request by http://living.sas.cornell.edu/dine/whattoeat/menus.cfm

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      java.lang.String getMenu()
      Grabs the menu for the given parameters with a GET request to Cornell servers
      protected void onPostExecute(java.lang.String result) 
      private java.lang.String parseHTMLForMenu(java.lang.String HTML)

      • returnMenuString

        public java.lang.String returnMenuString
        The String to be returned - defaults to error message so that if it remains unchanged the user is displayed a message

        private TextView menu
        The menu TextView that this information should be added to

      • MENU_PATTERN

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern MENU_PATTERN
        The menu regex pattern that matches an item on the menu

        Group 0: The entire string

        Group 1: The item string, either an item or header, e.g. "Turkey Burgers" or "Grill Station"

    • Constructor Detail

      • MenuRequester

        public MenuRequester(java.lang.String date,
             java.lang.String meal,
             Hall eats,
             TextView menu)
        Precondition: All parameters are formatted as needed for a POST request by http://living.sas.cornell.edu/dine/whattoeat/menus.cfm

        Scrapes information from the aforementioned URL about specific meal at date and location specified

        Parameters:
        date - The date to request menu information from
        meal - The meal, one of three possible strings "Breakfast", "Lunch", or "Dinner"
        hallName - The hall name, needed by the group request

    • Method Detail

      • getMenu

        public java.lang.String getMenu()
        Grabs the menu for the given parameters with a GET request to Cornell servers
        Returns:
        the parsed menu string formatted as HTML

      • parseHTMLForMenu

        private java.lang.String parseHTMLForMenu(java.lang.String HTML)
        Returns a neat menu string from raw HTML
        Parameters:
        HTML - HTML code from http://living.sas.cornell.edu/dine/whattoeat/menus.cfm retrieved from getMenu()
        Returns:
        neat menu string formatted with nice HTML
